comment.body:
> ### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
> [https://bleacherreport.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbleacherreport.com%2F)
> 
> ### Comment
> > Hi there 👋
> > I've had Adguard installed on Android and Windows 11 Chrome browser (the AG browser extension, not the system AG app) for a while, but this glitch accessing Bleacherreport.com ("something went wrong - try reloading" message) wasn't noticed til the last couple of weeks...
> > I reported it to the site's support department, and they mentioned that they couldn't reproduce it on their end and suggested it could be VPN-related - however I don't have a vpn running while trying to access the site on either platform.
> > Disabling the extension and mobile app do seem to fix the error message. It should be noted that adding the site to the "Allowlist" in the browser extension does not work.
> > Thanks for any guidance.
> 
> Username: `@GitAlexToTheGreek`
> 
> ### Screenshots
> Screenshot 1
> Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled
> ### System configuration
> Information	Value
> AdGuard product:	AdGuard Browser Extension v5.0.210 MV3
> System version:	Windows 11
> Browser:	Chrome
> Tracking protection options:	Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
> Hide your search queries,
> Send Do-Not-Track header,
> Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
> Self-destructing third-party cookies (2880),
> Block trackers
> Filters:	Ad blocking:
> AdGuard Base
> 
> Privacy:
> AdGuard Tracking Protection,
> AdGuard URL Tracking
> 
> Annoyances:
> AdGuard Cookie Notices,
> AdGuard Popups,
> AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
> AdGuard Other Annoyances
> 
> Language-specific:
> AdGuard French
> Browsing Security:	disabled
> Browsing Security statistics:	disabled
> Other extensions used:	Bitdefender Antivirus Free Build 27.0.49.250, Extensions: AdGuard, Bitwarden, Dark Reader, Enhancer For YouTube, Extensity, Free Download Manager, Read Aloud, Scrolling Screenshot & Full Page Markup App, Selection Search

Can confirm that after testing yesterday, the website operates as expected on both Windows desktop Chrome browser and Android Chrome browser app.

Thanks to those who addressed this, much appreciated. 🙂👍
